name: mastectomy
description: A surgical operation to remove one or both breasts, sometimes including the removal and replacement of breast tissue with an implant

values.name: left
values.description: Only the left breast has been removed

values.name: right
values.description: Only the right breast has been removed

attributes.name: implant
attributes.description: Presence of breast implants after mastectomy

values.name: left implant reconstruction
values.description: Only the left breast has an implant

values.name: right implant reconstruction
values.description: Only the right breast has an implant

values.name: saline
values.description: The implants are made of saline

values.name: silicone
values.description: The implants are made of silicone

attributes.name: axillary lymph node dissection
attributes.description: Evidence of prior lymph node dissection in one or both axillae

values.name: left
values.description: Evidence of lymph node dissection in the left axilla

values.name: right
values.description: Evidence of lymph node dissection in the right axilla

values.name: bilateral
values.description: Evidence of lymph node dissection in the both axillae

values.name: surgical clips
values.description: Surgical clips are noted in the axilla

values.name: intracapsular implant rupture
values.description: There is a rupture in the implant within the capsule

values.name: skin thickening
values.description: Thickening of the skin is observed

values.name: chest wall mass
values.description: No chest wall mass is observed

values.name: subcutaneous nodularity
values.description: Nodularity in the subcutaneous tissue is observed

attributes.name: flap reconstruction
attributes.description: Whether there has been muscle flap reconstruction

values.name: absent
values.description: There has not been flap reconstruction

examples.report_text: Chest Wall: Status post right mastectomy with flap reconstruction. Left axillary node dissection.
Chest Wall: Status post bilateral mastectomy.
Chest Wall: Surgical changes status post bilateral mastectomies with breast reconstructions.
SOFT TISSUE: Within normal limits. Status post right mastectomy with breast implant in place.
Chest Wall: Postsurgical changes are seen within the breasts bilaterally consistent bilateral mastectomy and flap reconstruction.
IMPRESSION: Stable postsurgical changes following the left mastectomy.
Chest Wall: Status post left mastectomy with implantation, no suspicious osseous lytic or blastic lesions.
Chest Wall: Postsurgical changes in the right breast status post lumpectomy.   Bones: No suspicious lytic or blastic lesions. Mild multilevel degenerative changes of the axial skeleton.
Chest Wall: Status post right mastectomy with flap reconstruction. The assessment of the breasts is limited on this chest CT, and please also refer to dedicated breast imaging for breast findings.
Chest Wall: Bilateral mastectomy with implant reconstruction, no chest wall mass.
Chest Wall: Right mastectomy with implant reconstruction. Multiple surgical clips in the right axilla post lymph node dissection.. No chest wall mass.
Chest Wall: Status post left breast mastectomy with implantation.   Bones: Osteopenia. Skeletal degenerative changes. No suspicious osseous lytic or blastic lesions.

Chest Wall: Postsurgical changes are seen within the breasts bilaterally consistent bilateral mastectomy and flap reconstruction. Partially calcified nodule in the left breast is stable in size.   Bones: No suspicious lytic or blastic lesions.
Chest Wall: Status post left mastectomy, surgical changes present.
Chest Wall: Bilateral mastectomy with bilateral prostheses in place. No chest wall mass.   Bones: Degenerative changes of the spine.
Chest Wall: Right mastectomy. Similar 4.5 x 2.1 cm right anterior chest wall enhancing soft tissue.
IMPRESSION:    1.  Stable 1.9 cm peripherally enhancing nodule in the RIGHT mastectomy site is likely secondary to postoperative change. Continued attention at follow-up advised.
